page.title: 09BRITISH AEROSPACE - BROUGH
page.content: Formed 1977.Origins in Blackburn Aircraft and Hawker Siddeley.Part of the Weybridge Division and is one of the largest employers on Humberside with 4,500 employees.It is a design and production centre primarily engaged on high peformance military aircraft although some civil aircraft project work is done.Brough Airfield is suitable for use by light aircraft. To celebrate the centenary of Mr.Robert Blackburn's birth some 200 guests on August 10th 1985 saw a fly past including the Blackburn B2 G-AEBJ bi-plane and the Harrier Jump Jet. Next day ex W/Cmdr Robert Sage aged 70 met the Blackburn B2 G-AEBJ plane at Elvington Nr York where it had been flown from Brough. He had flown the aircraft 50 years ago.It was there as part of an open day at the proposed site of the Yorkshire Air Museum.
